question: Expiry time of Salaat (prayers).
answer:
QUESTION
Respected Mufti Sahab, Till what time we can pray Salaat?ul Fajr. Here in UAE there are calendar?s in every mosque on which prayer timings are mentioned. Today (10 Safar, 3 May) Shurook time has been mentioned 05: 42 am, is this the expiry time of Fajr or some minutes before it and after how many minutes Ishrak time begins from Shurook time. Also please inform expiry time of Zohar, Asr, Magrib and Isha. Jazak Allah and Was Salaam.
ANSWER

Salaat must be offered at fixed time. Allah Ta'ala says in the noble Qur'%0D%0Aaan, 'Salaat at set time has been made a duty on the believers.' (Surah%0D%0AAn-Nisaa 4:103)%0D%0A%0D%0ATimings of Salaat are:%0D%0A%0D%0AFajr%0D%0A%3EFrom true dawn until just before sunrise.%0D%0A%0D%0APreferable to offer when it is light, not yet very dark, but preferable to%0D%0Adelay on cloudy day.%0D%0A%0D%0ADhuhr%0D%0AAfter midday until afternoon (when a shadow of a vertical object is twice it%0D%0A's length plus the meridian shadow).%0D%0A%0D%0APreferable to offer in summer after the intense heat rays elapse. In winter%0D%0Aat the beginning time but preferable to delay on cloudy day.%0D%0A%0D%0AAsr%0D%0A%3EFrom late afternoon (when a shadow of a vertical object is twice it's length%0D%0Aplus the meridian shadow) until just before sunset.%0D%0A%0D%0APreferable to delay to such an extent that the sun does not turn yellow but%0D%0Apreferable to offer a bit early on cloudy day.%0D%0A%0D%0AMaghrib%0D%0AAfter sunset until daylight ends.%0D%0A%0D%0APreferable to offer immediately after sunset and not to delay to the extent%0D%0Athat many stars begin to appear in the sky but preferable to delay on cloudy%0D%0Aday.%0D%0A%0D%0AIshaa%0D%0ANight until dawn.%0D%0A%0D%0APreferable to offer before one third of the night passes.%0D%0A%0D%0A[ Mufeedul Muslimeen, Mufti Ismail Kachholvi, UK ]%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A
